message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.CC

Reasoning: The paper deals with optimization problems in graphs, which is a common topic in computer science. The use of terms such as "NP-hard" and "approximable" suggests that the paper belongs to the Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. The study of graph classes such as bipartite graphs, split graphs, and k-trees suggests that the paper may also belong to the Computational Geometry (cs.CG) and Graph Theory (cs.GT) sub-categories. Finally, the mention of "hardness of approximation results" and "positive approximation results" suggests that the paper may also belong to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
